text:
One reason I prefer Gemini over ChatGPT is its ability to easily upload video files and process them to get insights, transcriptions, and more. 
I cannot believe why OpenAI has ignored this feature in ChatGPT.

ChatGPT vs Gemini vs Claude: What Actually Sets Them Apart

If you spend your days juggling content, research, client work, and data the way many of us do, you already know this debate is getting louder. Three major AI tools, three very different personalities. After testing

The issue with Chat GPT is the free version sucks. Gemini beats it any day of the week. If open ai wants to continue to be in the lead of LLM’s, there free version needs to improve. As a large majority of people using these models aren’t paying.

I ran the same prompts on ChatGPT 5.2 and Gemini 3.

The results shocked me.

ChatGPT felt like a senior engineer.
Precise. Logical. No fluff.

Gemini felt like a smart assistant.
Flexible. Practical. Plugged into real life.

Same task.
Very different brains.

Save this video,

As a long-term user who deeply integrates AI into work assistance  and co-creation, I’ve noticed a precipitous drop in my ChatGPT usage. This is driven by the immense friction from aggressive safety routing and the new model's diminishing EQ. I have to admit: for many scenarios,

chatGPT has a much better app than Gemini. Feels more coherent.

Gemini is smart, but constrained with an army of idiots from google who gave it a shitty interface, dumb restrictions, and god damn bugs that ruin chats.

Two Titans: ChatGPT 5.2 and Gemini 3 Pro

OpenAI and Google released their main models just a few weeks apart. Both claim to be the best – but in practice, each excels in its own area.

GPT-5.2 is better at writing code, solving math problems, and creating work documents. If

I am a noob but I felt Gemini was better at coding stuff I wanted. I use ChatGPT for just normal data or knowledge queries. It just couldn’t code tbh.
800m globally monthly active users wow
How much is India in this?

Artistically ChatGPT is much better.

Utility wise, Gemini is much better.

Dont move to Gemini if you use your ai app for work, more specifically if you use the **projects** feature. 

I tried this month Gemini ultra when gemini 3.0 pro got released, and had the worst experience ever : 

First, all my work related chats with **Gems**, that a used as an

ChatGPT's voice mode still blows Gemini out of the water.  I can talk for an hour and feel like I'm having a productive conversation that's hitting on what I want to cover.  With Gemini it seems to keep asking sort of irrelevant questions going down random rabbit holes that don't

ChatGPT in the lead because of how many times you have to prompt it to get the actual fucking answer you’re looking for lol. Gemini is a much better product at this point for verbal prompts, toss up on images
